page.title: 15HENWICK STATION. PART TWO.
page.content: The two fences between St.Clement's school playground and railway(one maintained by L.E.A. & the other by B.R) includes at least one strainer post made of G.W.R. broadgauge bridge rail.The bridge over the Severn is currently being repainted in olive green,red,cream & gold.Henwick station site is still used as a coal yard,with coal brought in by road & distributed by 2 independent firms with the same name (Hines).Lorries are also parked in the yard;building materials are stored there whilst the black goods shed is used as a store,as is the Taff Vale van body.Celsius central heating installers have a promotional caravan in the yard.The 1923 weighbridge (20 tons; Henry Pooley & Son Ltd)has been out of use since May 1984 but remains insitu.
